content.question: Region Capital Region Population Land Area (square miles) Gross Domestic Product (in euros) Languages Andalusia Seville 8.1 million 33,819 149 billion Andalusian Spanish Catalonia Barcelona 7.5 million 12,390 213 billion Castilian Spanish, Catalan, Occitan Madrid Madrid 6.5 million 3,099 211 billion Castilian Spanish Valencia Valencia 4.9 million 8,978 104 billion Castilian Spanish, Valencian Galicia Santiago de Compostela 2.7 million 11,418 53 billion Castilian Spanish, Galician Source: Britannica.com, Eurostat. Which of the following best explains why the region of Catalonia in Spain could be a viable country?

choices.label: Catalonia is linguistically distinct compared to other regions in Spain.
Catalonia is well developed economically compared to other regions in Spain.
Catalonia's population is ethnically distinct compared to other regions in Spain.
Catalonia has a large population compared to other regions in Spain.
Catalonia has a major city, Barcelona, which has a notoriety comparable to that of the Spanish capital, Madrid.

content.answer: Catalonia is well developed economically compared to other regions in Spain.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain what maps or data imply or illustrate about geographic principles, processes, and outcomes.
